title: Windows Open During Summer?
content: @Translink I am so happy the Morgan Freeman / Visa adverts were dropped as soon as they started. Anything other than emergency directions from a SkyTrain station PA system are simply noise pollution. Keep our cities quiet!— DennisSylvesterHurd  (@DennisSHurd) June 2, 2018 Our building is attached to the Columbia SkyTrain Station. Consequently, noise from there travels up the wall and into all both buildings' apartments. We have read of all sorts of extensive renovations for the original SkyTrain stations. Yet we've witnessed nothing about noise mitigation for us. When we moved here 20 years ago, there was just one Expo line with drastically fewer trains. So until you get things straightened out for those who live beside Columbia Station, keep those advertisements on hold.
